item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 28, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Dell is posting unsigned updates to their website which fail to install (112 points | 34 comments)
2. Malware can turn off webcam LED and record video, demonstrated on ThinkPad X230 (461 points | 287 comments)
3. A Washing Machine for Human Beings, from 1970 (33 points | 20 comments)
4. You can use C-Reduce for any language (296 points | 61 comments)
5. The Forgotten Story of How IBM Invented the Automated Fab (73 points | 10 comments)
6. Show HN: Voice-Pro – AI Voice Cloning Magic: Transform Any Voice in 15 Seconds (38 points | 25 comments)
7. Show HN: TeaTime – distributed book library powered by SQLite, IPFS and GitHub (120 points | 23 comments)
8. MIT Aluminum Bicycle Project 1974 (57 points | 37 comments)
9. Bluesky Social Dataset (235M posts from 4M users) (50 points | 29 comments)
10. Show HN: Feels Like Paper (153 points | 58 comments)
11. Sleep regularity and major adverse cardiovascular events (65 points | 12 comments)
12. PRoot: User-space implementation of chroot, mount –bind, and binfmt_misc (3 points | discuss)
13. For the Love of a Little Sea (9 points | discuss)
14. Where Glaciers Melt, the Rivers Run Red (4 points | discuss)
15. Structured Editing and Incremental Parsing (50 points | 8 comments)
16. Float Self-Tagging (57 points | 10 comments)
17. Developing a cancer drug without Big Pharma: this hospital shows it can be done (45 points | 12 comments)
18. Generate video sprites using just FFmpeg (61 points | 15 comments)
19. TrunkVer (74 points | 32 comments)
20. Device-detector: Universal Device Detection library from User Agent (57 points | 9 comments)
21. Tornado Cash Sanctions Found Illegal, in Legal Win for Crypto (23 points | 7 comments)
22. Pocket 4: Modular full-featured Handheld AI PC (17 points | 9 comments)
23. Ancient Sumerians created the first writing system (145 points | 154 comments)
24. 500 Million, But Not a Single One More (43 points | 2 comments)
25. Ultra-low-latency, batching and concurrent queue for IPC in Java (52 points | 20 comments)
26. QwQ: Alibaba's O1 Like Reasoning LLM (171 points | 119 comments)
27. Psychoacoustic and archeoacoustic nature of ancient Aztec skull whistles (51 points | 25 comments)
28. Show HN: App that asks ‘why?’ every time you unlock your phone (662 points | 329 comments)
29. Python type hints may not be not for me in practice (83 points | 149 comments)
30. RomCom exploits Firefox and Windows zero days in the wild (42 points | 21 comments)
